content:
üìö Study Material - National Women's Day (Feb 13) & Sarojini Naidu

This section covers the life of the 'Nightingale of India' and her pioneering role in the Indian Freedom Struggle, which is a core part of the Modern History syllabus.

üáÆüá≥ Sarojini Naidu: The Nightingale of India:

  • National Women's Day: Celebrated on Feb 13 to commemorate her birth anniversary. (Note: International Women's Day is March 8).
  • INC Presidency: She was the first Indian woman to become the President of the Indian National Army (Kanpur Session, 1925).
  • First Woman Governor: After independence, she became the Governor of the United Provinces (now Uttar Pradesh), making her the first woman to hold this office in India.

üìú Key Contributions & Literature:

  • Freedom Struggle: She played a vital role in the Civil Disobedience Movement and the Dandi March (1930).
  • Poetry: Her famous works include 'The Golden Threshold', 'The Bird of Time', and 'The Broken Wing'.

Important Topics for Exams:

  • Important INC Sessions and their Presidents
  • First Women in India (First Governor, First CM, First President)
  • Books and Authors of the Indian Freedom Struggle

questions.q: ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∏ ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§™‡§π‡§≤‡•Ä ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑ ‡§ï‡•å‡§® ‡§•‡•Ä‡§Ç? (Who was the first Indian woman President of the Indian National Army?)

‡§∏‡§∞‡•ã‡§ú‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§°‡•Ç ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§™‡§π‡§≤‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡§æ‡§≤ ‡§¨‡§®‡•Ä‡§Ç? (Sarojini Naidu became the first woman Governor of which state?)
questions.rationale: ‡§µ‡§π ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ç‡§§ (‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§æ‡§® ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•á‡§∂) ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§™‡§π‡§≤‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡§æ‡§≤ ‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§ ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§ó‡§à ‡§•‡•Ä‡§Ç‡•§ (She was appointed as the first woman Governor of United Provinces, now Uttar Pradesh.)

questions.q: '‡§¶ ‡§ó‡•ã‡§≤‡•ç‡§°‡§® ‡§•‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∂‡•ã‡§≤‡•ç‡§°' (The Golden Threshold) ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ï ‡§ï‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π ‡§ï‡•á ‡§≤‡•á‡§ñ‡§ï ‡§ï‡•å‡§® ‡§π‡•à‡§Ç? (Who is the author of the poetry collection titled 'The Golden Threshold'?)
questions.rationale: ‡§Ø‡§π ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ã‡§ú‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§°‡•Ç ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§™‡§π‡§≤‡§æ ‡§ï‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π ‡§•‡§æ, ‡§ú‡§ø‡§∏‡§ï‡•á ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡§£ ‡§â‡§®‡•ç‡§π‡•á‡§Ç '‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§ ‡§ï‡•ã‡§ï‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ' ‡§ï‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡§Ø‡§æ‡•§ (This was Sarojini Naidu's first collection of poems, which earned her the title 'Nightingale of India'.)

questions.q: ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ã‡§ú‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§°‡•Ç ‡§®‡•á ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§Ü‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ã‡§≤‡§® ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§•‡§æ? (In which movement did Sarojini Naidu participate?)
Fundamental Duties were added to the Indian Constitution by which Constitutional Amendment?
questions.rationale: Fundamental Duties were added via the 42nd Amendment in 1976[cite: 19, 20, 21, 22].

questions.q: ‡§Æ‡•å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§ú‡§º‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡§æ‡§® ‡§ï‡•á ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§ï‡§≤ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§π‡•à? (Fundamental Duties are mentioned in which Article?)
questions.rationale: Fundamental Duties are listed under Article 51A of the Indian Constitution[cite: 19, 27].
The 42nd Constitutional Amendment Act, often called the 'Mini Constitution', added Fundamental Duties[cite: 34, 36, 41].
The total outlay for the Uttar Pradesh Budget for 2026-27 is ‚Çπ9.13 lakh crore[cite: 53, 60].
Denmark secured the top position in the Corruption Perceptions Index (CPI) 2025[cite: 66, 72].
The United States has the highest number of billionaires according to the UBS 2025 report[cite: 87, 93].
India was designated 'Country of the Year' at BIOFACH 2026 held in Germany[cite: 182, 183, 251, 257].
The pact was signed on February 10, 2026, to prevent double social security contributions[cite: 302, 314, 321].
Manu Bhaker clinched the silver medal in the women's 25m Pistol event in New Delhi[cite: 193, 194, 333, 339, 368].
The United Nations declared February 11 as the International Day of Women and Girls in Science[cite: 197, 379, 388, 389].
Thanya Nathan C., age 24, secured Rank 1 in the disability merit list of the Kerala Judicial Service Exam[cite: 226, 233, 542, 546, 560].
The theme for National Productivity Day, observed on Feb 12, is 'Clusters as Growth Engine'[cite: 530, 535].
SCALP (Storm Shadow) is a long-range cruise missile jointly developed by France and the United Kingdom[cite: 446, 450, 462, 465].
MILAN is a multilateral naval exercise being held in the 'City of Destiny', Visakhapatnam[cite: 601, 611, 614].
Former Governor Biswabhusan Harichandan authored the books 'Bakshi Jagabandhu' and 'E Mati Katha Kahe'[cite: 406, 411, 425, 437].
Jim Corbett National Park, located in Uttarakhand, is India's first national park[cite: 621, 626, 631, 633].

questions.q: ‡§Æ‡•å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§ú‡§º‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡§æ‡§® ‡§ï‡•á ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§ï‡§≤ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§π‡•à? (Fundamental Duties are mentioned in which Article?)
questions.rationale: Fundamental Duties are listed under Article 51A of the Indian Constitution, added by the 42nd Amendment.

questions.q: ‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§°‡§Æ‡§æ‡§® ‡§î‡§∞ ‡§®‡§ø‡§ï‡•ã‡§¨‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§™ ‡§™‡§∞ ‡§π‡§æ‡§≤ ‡§π‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•Ä‡§ö‡§°‡§º ‡§ú‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•Ä (Mud Volcano) ‡§´‡§ü‡§æ ‡§π‡•à? (On which island of Andaman and Nicobar did a mud volcano recently erupt?)
questions.rationale: A mud volcano recently erupted on Baratang Island in the Andaman and Nicobar archipelago (Feb 13, 2026).

questions.q: ‡§®‡•á‡§ü‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï ‡§∞‡•á‡§°‡•Ä‡§®‡•á‡§∏ ‡§á‡§Ç‡§°‡•á‡§ï‡•ç‡§∏ 2026 ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§ ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§∞‡•à‡§Ç‡§ï ‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§π‡•à? (What is India's rank in the Network Readiness Index 2026?)
questions.rationale: India ranked 45th out of 127 countries in the Network Readiness Index released by the Portulans Institute.

questions.q: ‡§¶‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§≤‡•Ä ‡§∏‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•Ä '‡§≤‡§ñ‡§™‡§§‡§ø ‡§¨‡§ø‡§ü‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ' ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§â‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§π‡•à? (What is the main objective of Delhi Govt's 'Lakhpati Bitiya Yojana'?)
questions.rationale: Under this scheme, ‚Çπ1 lakh is provided to girls upon completing graduation to support further studies.

questions.q: ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§ ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§§‡•Ä‡§∏‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§¨‡§°‡§º‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•å‡§∞ ‡§µ‡•á‡§ß‡§∂‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ (Solar Observatory) ‡§ï‡§π‡§æ‡§Å ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§™‡§ø‡§§ ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§ú‡§æ ‡§∞‡§π‡•Ä ‡§π‡•à? (Where is India's third major solar observatory being established?)
questions.rationale: The National Large Solar Telescope (NLSO) is being set up in Ladakh, following Kodaikanal and Udaipur.
India thrashed Namibia by 93 runs at the Arun Jaitley Stadium on February 12, 2026.

questions.q: ‡§™‡•å‡§ß‡•ã‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç '‡§´‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§è‡§Æ' (Phloem) ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§π‡•à? (What is the main function of Phloem in plants?)
questions.rationale: Phloem transports nutrients and sugars (food) from leaves to other parts of the plant.
Union Minister Amit Shah announced White Revolution 2.0 to empower women in the dairy cooperative sector.

questions.q: ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§-‡§Ø‡•Ç‡§ï‡•á ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ú‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Å‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§ù‡•å‡§§‡•á ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§≤‡§æ‡§≠ ‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§π‡•à? (What is the main benefit of the India-UK Social Security Agreement?)
questions.rationale: This agreement prevents Indian workers in the UK and vice-versa from paying social security taxes in both countries.

questions.q: ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§™‡§π‡§≤‡•Ä ‡§¨‡§æ‡§∞ '‡§á‡§Ç‡§°‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ-AI ‡§á‡§Æ‡•ç‡§™‡•à‡§ï‡•ç‡§ü ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ü 2026' ‡§ï‡§π‡§æ‡§Å ‡§Ü‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§ø‡§§ ‡§π‡•ã‡§ó‡•Ä? (Where will the 'India-AI Impact Summit 2026' be held for the first time?)
questions.rationale: The summit will be held from 16-20 February 2026 at Bharat Mandapam, New Delhi.

questions.q: NABARD ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§™‡§®‡§æ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ö‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§¶‡•å‡§∞‡§æ‡§® ‡§π‡•Å‡§à ‡§•‡•Ä? (NABARD was established during which Five Year Plan?)
questions.rationale: NABARD was established in 1982 during the Sixth Five Year Plan (1980-85).

questions.q: ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡§æ‡§® ‡§ï‡•á ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Å‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•á‡§¶ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§§‡§π‡§§ '‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞' ‡§è‡§ï ‡§Æ‡•å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§π‡•à? (Under which Article is 'Right to Education' a Fundamental Right?)
questions.rationale: Article 21A declares that the State shall provide free and compulsory education to all children of 6 to 14 years.
Lila Ram Sangwan was the first Indian to win gold in Commonwealth Games (1958) in heavyweight wrestling.
Barren Island in the Andaman Sea is the only confirmed active volcano in South Asia.

questions.q: ‡§ï‡•ã‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ ‡§ï‡•Ä '‡§Ü‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ò‡§æ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§•‡•à‡§≤‡•Ä' ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏‡•á ‡§ï‡§π‡§æ ‡§ú‡§æ‡§§‡§æ ‡§π‡•à? (Which organelle is known as the 'Suicide Bag' of the cell?)
questions.rationale: Lysosomes are called suicide bags because they contain digestive enzymes that can destroy the cell itself if it is damaged.

questions.q: ‡§´‡§∞‡§µ‡§∞‡•Ä 2026 ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§¶‡•á‡§∂ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç '‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§æ‡§§ ‡§ó‡•á‡§ú‡§º‡§æ‡§®‡•Ä' (Cyclone Gezani) ‡§®‡•á ‡§§‡§¨‡§æ‡§π‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡§ö‡§æ‡§à? (Which country was hit by 'Cyclone Gezani' in February 2026?)
questions.rationale: Cyclone Gezani hit Madagascar in Feb 2026, causing significant displacement and loss of life.

questions.q: ‡§™‡•Ä‡§è‡§Æ-‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏‡§æ‡§® (PM-KISAN) ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§§‡§π‡§§ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏‡§æ‡§®‡•ã‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§ø ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§§‡§®‡•Ä ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø ‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§ú‡§æ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§π‡•à? (How much annual amount is given to farmers under PM-KISAN scheme?)
questions.rationale: Under PM-KISAN, ‚Çπ6,000 per year is provided in three equal installments directly to bank accounts.

questions.q: ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§ ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§∏‡§¨‡§∏‡•á ‡§¨‡§°‡§º‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§®‡§æ‡§ú ‡§≠‡§Ç‡§°‡§æ‡§∞‡§£ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ (WLGSP) ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§∂‡•Å‡§∞‡•Ç ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§ó‡§à ‡§π‡•à? (In which sector has the World's Largest Grain Storage Plan been launched?)
questions.rationale: The World's Largest Grain Storage Plan is being implemented in the Cooperative Sector to benefit PACS.

questions.q: ‡§π‡§µ‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§π‡§≤ (‡§ú‡§Ø‡§™‡•Å‡§∞) ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡§æ ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§™‡§ø‡§§ ‡§π‡•à? (To which deity is Hawa Mahal, Jaipur dedicated?)
questions.rationale: Hawa Mahal was built by Sawai Pratap Singh and is dedicated to Lord Krishna and Radha.

questions.q: BRICS ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ñ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Æ‡•á‡§≤‡§® 2026 ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§Ö‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡§æ ‡§ï‡•å‡§® ‡§∏‡§æ ‡§¶‡•á‡§∂ ‡§ï‡§∞‡•á‡§ó‡§æ? (Which country will chair the BRICS Summit 2026?)
questions.rationale: India is set to chair the BRICS Summit for the 4th time in 2026.

questions.q: ‡§ö‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®-4 ‡§ï‡•á ‡§≤‡•à‡§Ç‡§°‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ó ‡§∏‡§æ‡§á‡§ü '‡§Æ‡•ã‡§Ç‡§∏ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§â‡§ü‡§®' (Mons Mouton) ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏‡§ï‡•á ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§™‡§∞ ‡§∞‡§ñ‡§æ ‡§ó‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§π‡•à? (After whom is the Chandrayaan-4 landing site 'Mons Mouton' named?)
questions.rationale: Mons Mouton is named after Melba Mouton, a NASA mathematician who was a leader among the 'Human Computers'.

questions.q: ‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§∏‡§≠‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑ (Speaker) ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§™‡§¶ ‡§∏‡•á ‡§π‡§ü‡§æ‡§®‡•á ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§ß‡§æ‡§® ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Å‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•á‡§¶ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§π‡•à? (Under which Article can the Lok Sabha Speaker be removed from office?)
questions.rationale: Article 94 provides for the vacation, resignation, and removal of the Speaker and Deputy Speaker of the Lok Sabha.

questions.q: ‡§π‡§æ‡§≤ ‡§π‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•á‡§∞‡§≤ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§ñ‡•ã‡§ú‡•Ä ‡§ó‡§à '‡§≤‡§ø‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§•‡•á‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§ï‡•á‡§∞‡§≤‡•á‡§Ç‡§∏‡§ø‡§∏' (Lyriothemis keralensis) ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§è‡§ï ‡§®‡§à ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ú‡§æ‡§§‡§ø ‡§π‡•à? ('Lyriothemis keralensis', recently discovered in Kerala, is a new species of?)
questions.rationale: It is a new species of dragonfly discovered in the Western Ghats of Kerala.

questions.q: ‡§´‡§∞‡§µ‡§∞‡•Ä 2026 ‡§§‡§ï ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ '‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§∏‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§á‡§ü‡•ç‡§∏' (Ramsar Sites) ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§§‡§®‡•Ä ‡§π‡•à? (What is the total number of Ramsar Sites in India as of February 2026?)
questions.rationale: India currently has 98 Ramsar Sites, reflecting its commitment to wetland conservation.

questions.q: ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§-‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∏ ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§ù‡•å‡§§‡•á ‡§ï‡•á ‡§§‡§π‡§§ ‡§ï‡•å‡§® ‡§∏‡§æ ‡§¶‡•á‡§∂ '‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡•ã‡§∏' ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∏‡§æ‡§á‡§≤ ‡§ñ‡§∞‡•Ä‡§¶‡§®‡•á ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§∞‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø ‡§¶‡§ø‡§ñ‡§æ ‡§∞‡§π‡§æ ‡§π‡•à? (Under the India-Greece defense pact, which country is showing interest in buying 'BrahMos' missiles?)
questions.rationale: Greece has shown significant interest in the BrahMos supersonic cruise missile following the strategic defense partnership with India.

questions.q: ‡§ï‡•ã‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§ó ‡§ï‡•ã '‡§ï‡•ã‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§™‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§â‡§∏' ‡§ï‡§π‡§æ ‡§ú‡§æ‡§§‡§æ ‡§π‡•à? (Which cell organelle is called the 'Powerhouse of the cell'?)
questions.rationale: Mitochondria are known as the powerhouse because they produce ATP, the energy currency of the cell.
The Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP), led by Tarique Rahman, secured a landslide victory with around 218 seats.

questions.q: ‡§Ö‡§∏‡§Æ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§á‡§´‡§≤‡•ç‡§∏ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§°‡•â‡§ó ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§° ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§≤ ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§ú‡§æ‡§®‡•á ‡§µ‡§æ‡§≤‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡•Ä ‡§®‡§∏‡•ç‡§≤ '‡§ï‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§æ‡§à' (Kombai) ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§π‡•à? (The indigenous breed 'Kombai' to be added to Assam Rifles dog squad belongs to which state?)
questions.rationale: Kombai is a native breed from Tamil Nadu, while Tangkhul Hui is from Manipur.
EximPe secured the final PA-CB authorization from RBI for international payments.

questions.q: ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡§æ‡§® ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§ï‡•å‡§® ‡§∏‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Å‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•á‡§¶ '‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§® ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡§æ' (Uniform Civil Code) ‡§∏‡•á ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§¨‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§§ ‡§π‡•à? (Which Article of the Constitution deals with the 'Uniform Civil Code'?)
questions.rationale: Article 44 of the Directive Principles of State Policy (DPSP) advocates for a Uniform Civil Code for all citizens.

questions.q: ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§ ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§™‡§π‡§≤‡§æ 'LNG-‡§°‡•Ä‡§ú‡§≤' ‡§π‡§æ‡§á‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§° ‡§ü‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§® ‡§á‡§Ç‡§ú‡§® ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§∞‡•á‡§≤ ‡§ú‡•ã‡§® ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ ‡§≤‡•â‡§®‡•ç‡§ö ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ó‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§π‡•à? (India's first 'LNG-Diesel' hybrid train engine has been launched by which rail zone?)
questions.rationale: Northern Railway launched the country's first DEMU train using an LNG‚Äìdiesel dual-fuel system to reduce emissions.

questions.q: ‡§π‡§æ‡§≤ ‡§π‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç '‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§æ‡§§ ‡§ó‡•á‡§ú‡§º‡§æ‡§®‡•Ä' ‡§®‡•á ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§™ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ? (Which island nation was recently affected by 'Cyclone Gezani'?)
questions.rationale: Cyclone Gezani hit Madagascar in February 2026, causing heavy rainfall and displacement.

questions.rationale: Human blood is slightly basic with a normal pH range of 7.35 to 7.45.

questions.q: '‡§™‡•Ä‡§è‡§Æ-‡§°‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§á‡§®' (PM-DevINE) ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§≤‡§ø‡§è ‡§π‡•à? ('PM-DevINE' scheme is for the development of which region?)
questions.rationale: PM-DevINE (Prime Minister‚Äôs Development Initiative for North East Region) focuses on infrastructure and social projects in the NE states.

questions.q: '‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä ‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§Ç‡§¶ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä' ‡§ï‡•Ä 202‡§µ‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§ú‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•Ä ‡§ï‡§¨ ‡§Æ‡§®‡§æ‡§à ‡§ó‡§à? (When was the 202nd birth anniversary of 'Swami Dayanand Saraswati' celebrated?)
questions.rationale: His 202nd birth anniversary was observed on February 12, 2026. He was the founder of Arya Samaj.

questions.q: DNA ‡§ï‡§æ '‡§°‡§¨‡§≤ ‡§π‡•á‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∏' ‡§Æ‡•â‡§°‡§≤ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏‡§®‡•á ‡§¶‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§•‡§æ? (Who proposed the 'Double Helix' model of DNA?)
questions.rationale: James Watson and Francis Crick proposed the double helix structure of DNA in 1953.

questions.rationale: AgriStack is a collection of digital databases, including a Farmer Registry and Crop Sown Registry.

(By which amendment was the 'Right to Property' removed from Fundamental Rights?)
questions.rationale: The 44th Amendment Act (1978) turned the Right to Property into a legal right under Article 300A.

questions.q: ‡§π‡§æ‡§≤ ‡§π‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç '‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§æ ‡§§‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§•' (Seva Teerth) ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∏‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§â‡§¶‡•ç‡§ò‡§æ‡§ü‡§® ‡§ï‡§π‡§æ‡§Å ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ó‡§Ø‡§æ? (Where was the 'Seva Teerth' complex recently inaugurated?)
questions.rationale: PM Modi inaugurated the Seva Teerth complex as the new Prime Minister's Office (PMO) in New Delhi on Feb 13, 2026.

questions.q: ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§µ ‡§∂‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§§‡§®‡•Ä ‡§π‡§°‡•ç‡§°‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§π‡•ã‡§§‡•Ä ‡§π‡•à‡§Ç? (How many bones are there in the adult human body?)
questions.rationale: An adult human body has 206 bones, while infants are born with around 270.

questions.q: ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§®‡•á 2026 ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§¨‡§∏‡•á ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ä‡§® ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡§® (Wool Production) ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ? (Which Indian state recorded the highest wool production in 2026?)
questions.rationale: Rajasthan remains the top wool producer in India, accounting for nearly 47.5% of the national output.

questions.q: ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ (RTE) ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑ ‡§≤‡§æ‡§ó‡•Ç ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ó‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§•‡§æ? (In which year was the Right to Education (RTE) Act implemented?)
questions.rationale: The RTE Act was passed in 2009 but came into effect on April 1, 2010.

questions.q: ‡§™‡•å‡§ß‡•ã‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç '‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•á‡§∑‡§£' (Photosynthesis) ‡§ï‡•á ‡§≤‡§ø‡§è ‡§ï‡•å‡§® ‡§∏‡•Ä ‡§ó‡•à‡§∏ ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï ‡§π‡•à? (Which gas is essential for photosynthesis in plants?)
questions.rationale: Plants take in Carbon Dioxide and release Oxygen during the process of photosynthesis.

questions.q: ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Å‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•á‡§¶ 21‡§è (Article 21A) ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§Ü‡§Ø‡•Å ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó ‡§ï‡•á ‡§¨‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡•ã‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•á ‡§≤‡§ø‡§è ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ ‡§∏‡•Å‡§®‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§§‡§æ ‡§π‡•à? (Article 21A ensures education for children of which age group?)

questions.q: ‡§á‡§Ç‡§∏‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§® (Insulin) ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ ‡§∂‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§ó ‡§∏‡•á ‡§π‡•ã‡§§‡§æ ‡§π‡•à? (Which organ of the body secretes Insulin?)
questions.rationale: Insulin is secreted by the beta cells of the Pancreas to regulate blood sugar levels.

questions.q: ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§ ‡§ï‡§æ '‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§∞' (Egypt) ‡§ï‡•á ‡§∏‡§æ‡§• ‡§π‡§æ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ ‡§∏‡§π‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§™‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§§ ‡§π‡•à? (What is India's recent defense cooperation with Egypt focused on?)
questions.rationale: Egypt has shown interest in procuring India's LCA Tejas fighter jets for its air force.

questions.q: ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡§æ‡§® ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç '‡§è‡§ï‡§≤ ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§§‡§æ' ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ö‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§π‡§æ‡§Å ‡§∏‡•á ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ó‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§π‡•à? (The idea of 'Single Citizenship' in the Indian Constitution is taken from?)
questions.rationale: The provision of single citizenship was borrowed from the British Constitution.
